revised_title: Fossil Plants of the Mount Potts Beds, New Zealand
tldr: The author discusses the fossil plants of the Mount Potts beds in New Zealand, collected by Mr. D. G. Lillie during Captain Scott's Antarctic expedition. The plants are determined to be of Rhaeto-Jurassic age, and their discovery sheds light on the geological history of New Zealand and its connection to Gondwanaland.
